item.description:
Bigelow Hollow is a great CT state park along the MA border that's less that's less than 90 minutes from Providence. Given that this is only a week away from Xmas.. I thought this would be a nice opportunity to take a break from holiday preparations to get out for a 'quick hit' loop hike around Breakneck Pond.

UPDATE: Due to the high interest in this hike I've expanded the limit to 20. We will split into two groups (Jeff will lead group 'B') and start off in opposite directions along the same loop.

 Also, in the spirit of the holiday theme: Please bring a small ($2 - $3) gift to exchange between our groups for when we meet up on the trail. (of course this is optional for any Scrooges out there)

 This will be a 7.25 mile rolling hills loop which should take around 4-5 hours. (So no car shuttling and you should be back home in time to do some wrapping!) Expectation is for it to be a boots/spikes trek.. but have the snowshoes on standby if we get a white christmas!

Route: North along the Ridge Trail (blue/orange) and return on the East Ridge Trail (white) to the Nipmuck Trail (blue)

Park website: http://www.ct.gov/dep/cwp/view.asp?A=2716&Q=325174

Trail map: http://www.ct.gov/dep/lib/dep/stateparks/maps/big_nipm.pdf

Google Map:  287.Bigelow.Hollow.Road.Union.CT

 

(kudos to Jeff for this excellent checklist..)

EQUIPMENT CHECKLIST

fluorescent orange to increase your visibility as this is hunting season

Cold Weather Essentials (required):

• Synthetic Quick-drying Pants
• Synthetic Quick-drying L/S Shirt
• Sturdy Hiking Boots/shoes (preferably waterproof)
• Synthetic/Wool Socks
• Insulated/Fleece Jacket
• Light/Mid-weight Insulating Layers (undershirt/underpants)
• Extra pair of Socks
• Hat/Gloves
• Rain/Soft Shell Jacket/Pants
• Water (2-3L)
• Headlamp/Flashlight
• Map/Compass/Whistle
• Lunch
• Snack/Energy Food (extra food)
• MICROspikes, STABLicers, ect... (a must when there's snow or ice on the trail)


the Remaining Essentials:

• Medications/First Aid Supplies
• Emergency Blanket (so small & light, there's hardly a reason not to have one in your pack)
• Fire (waterproof matches, lighter, starter)
• Repair Kit/Knife

Optional:

• Sunscreen/Sunglasses/Bug Repellant/Toiletries
• Light-weight Wind Jacket (if your insulated or rain jacket isn’t windproof)
• Hand Warmers
• Trekking Poles
• Gaiters
• Light-weight Emergency Shelter
• Camera/Binoculars

item.how_to_find_us: We will meet at the trailhead parking lot at the North end of Bigelow Pond. Follow Park Road from the main entrance for ~1 mile and take a left turn.
